page.title: 11WATER SUPPLIES
page.content: As the names Burwell and Maidenwell suggest many of the villages in this area were built near sources of fresh water. The wells and springs were used until recent times. In Burwell the spring can still be seen and used, although mains water was put on about 30 years ago. Maidenwell and Ruckland were only connected to the mains this year, probably because of the high nitrate levels in the local water. The youth hostel at Ruckland and the Outdoor Pursuit Centre at Maidenwell still do not have a supply of running water. Water has to be taken in containers or "carted" from a local farm.
